LOC, note transcription error "LENA KRAUTLY"

comment.author: 91829349@N00
comment._content: "Jitney" = "nickel," for those unfamiliar with early 20th century Americanish.

comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: I can't find anything on these two women. There was a jitney bus (i.e., shared-ride, independent, unorganized 5 cent public transportation) craze in America in 1914 and 1915. The March 30, 1915 New York Times ran a long story on the phenomenon, noting there were at least some female entepreneurs involved. At that point, there were not jitneys in New York City, but the article said they were "at our gates." query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=F60B12F73F5D1A728... Here's a novelty song about the craze: www.authentichistory.com/1898-1913/1-industrialization/5-...
